title: Israel-Hamas war: France's Jewish community concerned about upsurge in anti-Semitic acts
summary: While there have been no reports of violent attacks, the Interior Ministry has documented 501 anti-Semitic acts since the Hamas attack in Israel on October 7. Out of fear, some people are avoiding any outward signs of their Jewish identity.

title: Mexico: Photos of the aftermath of Hurricane Otis in Acapulco
summary: The renowned coastal destination of Acapulco in southwestern Mexico was partially devastated on Thursday after powerful Hurricane Otis cut it off from the rest of the country.

title: In Montreal too, being a woman in tech isn't all it's cracked up to be
summary: In this Quebec hub of artificial intelligence research, women hold only 22% of sector positions, mostly in human resources, not in developer roles. Gender stereotypes are a major barrier to recruitment, although female success stories do exist.

title: The luxury sector is also impacted by the economic slowdown
summary: With a 9% decline in third-quarter sales, Kering is struggling to maintain its performance, while Hermès handbags continue to set new records.

title: One year after his Twitter takeover, has Elon Musk kept his promises?
summary: There's no doubt the social media platform has changed since the multi-billionaire took the helm – and not just the name, nox X. But the whimsical business tycoon's grand plans have only been partially implemented.

title: In Argentina, the boom of 'specialty coffee shops'
summary: In the land of maté, the coffee served in coffee shops has long been of poor quality, but things are changing with the emergence of numerous highly profitable businesses that offer entrepreneurs an anti-crisis formula.

title: One-third of Gaza hospitals out of operation due to Israeli bombardments and blockade
summary: In 24 to 48 hours, most hospitals in the Palestinian enclave will be without electricity due to a lack of fuel to run their generators.

title: Maine mass shooting: At least 18 people killed in shootings in Lewiston, says governor
summary: Maine's governor says at least 18 people were killed and 13 were injured in shootings, and state police have issued a murder warrant for the suspect who is a trained firearms instructor and is still at large.

title: Democratic Republic of Congo rocked by new M23 rebel offensive
summary: Rebels attacked the town of Bambo, north of Goma (eastern DRC), the latest in a conflict that the United Nations says has displaced almost 200,000 people since October 1.

title: UN chief establishes panel to advise on global governance of artificial intelligence
summary: UN Secretary-General António Guterres on Thursday announced the appointment of a global advisory panel to report on international governance of artificial intelligence and its risks, challenges and key opportunities.

title: US federal judge rules for redrawing discriminatory Georgian voting districts
summary: The judge ordered the drawing of 1 Black-majority congressional district, 2 state Senate and 5 state House Black-majority districts. The case is part of a wave of redistricting litigation in the US.

title: Giorgia Meloni's break-up is Italy's hot new soap opera
summary: The prime minister announced she and her partner were separating after he was recorded making lewd comments.

title: Armenia PM hopes for peace deal with Azerbaijan 'in the coming months'
summary: Baku took control of the mountainous region in September after an offensive that ended decades of pro-Armenian separatist rule.

title: Slovakia announces halt of military aid to Ukraine
summary: Slovakia's new Prime Minister Robert Fico announced the halt of aid to Ukraine after he swore in a new government on Wednesday.

title: In Somalia, plans to withdraw African Union troops raise fears of a security vacuum
summary: At Mogadishu's request, 17,500 ATMIS soldiers are due to leave the country by December 2024. There are fears their withdrawal will create a security vacuum, as the Somalian army struggles to consolidate its positions against al-Shabaab Islamists.

title: French escape artist Rédoine Faïd sentenced to 14 years in a disproportionate trial
summary: The incident-filled trial over the 2018 helicopter prison escape was long, chaotic and fraught with every possible incident. It was poorly managed by a judge overwhelmed by the defendants.

title: Victor Wembanyama frustrated and promising in mixed NBA debut
summary: With a highly anticipated league debut, the number one draft pick delivered a mixed performance in the San Antonio Spurs' 126-119 loss to the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Macron, on diplomatic dash, tries to convince counterparts across region
summary: The French president visited Israel, the West Bank, Jordan, and Egypt in a whirlwind tour of the region. Having spoken of his 'solidarity' with Israel, on Wednesday he warned against a 'massive ground invasion' and promised humanitarian efforts for Gaza.

title: Why Ukraine's counter-offensive is failing
summary: The attempted Ukrainian advance through Russian lines is no longer making headway. Despite heavy losses, Moscow's forces have regained the initiative by launching assaults since October 10 on the Donbas town of Avdiivka.

title: Former Chinese premier Li Keqiang dies of a heart attack at 68
summary: Li, a reform-minded bureaucrat, was considered a contender to succeed then-Communist Party leader Hu Jintao in 2013 but was passed over in favor of Xi Jinping, under whom he served as premier for 10 years.

title: US launches airstrikes on Iranian-linked targets in Syria
summary: According to US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, the strikes are a response to a series of ongoing attacks against US personnel in Iraq and Syria by Iranian-backed militia groups since October 17.

title: Saw X: The bloody return of John Kramer, virtuoso of the human barbecue
summary: The saga's tenth installment stays true to its agenda, this time with a series of torture scenes directed against a fake medical team who exploit distressed patients.

title: US economy grows at fastest rate in nearly two years
summary: The US economy expanded at a robust 4.9% annual rate from July through September as Americans defied higher prices, rising interest rates and widespread forecasts of a recession to spend at a brisk pace.

title: Israeli army claims 'ground forces' conducted night raid in Gaza
summary: The army conducted a similar ground operation using tanks and infantry the previous night in the northern part of the Palestinian territory.

title: Behind the US's surprisingly strong third-quarter growth
summary: Between July and September, gross domestic product grew by 4.9%, driven by public spending and household consumption, which proved resilient despite the rise in interest rates.

title: Mexican city of Acapulco devastated by Hurricane Otis
summary: Everything from cars and sailboats to power poles, roofs and trees seemed to go flying as the hurricane passed through, with winds exceeding 300 km/h. According to initial estimates, 27 people died and 80% of hotels were destroyed.

title: Johann Soufi, a voice for Gaza
summary: The lawyer, who has worked for the United Nations agency in charge of Palestinian refugees in the Middle East, is worried about the fate of Gazans and the thousands internally displaced within the enclave.

title: A hostage freed by Hamas campaigned all her life for Palestinian rights
summary: Yocheved Lifshitz, an 85-year-old, was released on Tuesday after being kidnapped on October 7 from the Nir Oz kibbutz. She and her husband, who is still held captive, were tireless protestors against the living conditions in Gaza.

title: Brian Eno gives a rare and brief Paris concert
summary: The English musician, composer and producer, known for his work with David Bowie and U2, had not performed in France since 1975.

title: European leaders torn between the fronts in Ukraine and the Middle East
summary: At a Council meeting on Thursday, the leaders of the European Union, with the exception of Slovakia and Hungary, reaffirmed their support for Kyiv, but spent most of their time drafting a joint declaration on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Israel's economy hit hard by war against Hamas
summary: Since the October 7 attack, all sectors in Israel, including construction, tech, agriculture and textiles, have been affected by labor shortages.

title: Being gay and Catholic, a difficult journey 'between two worlds'
summary: Some Catholics experience an ongoing internal conflict between their faith and their identity as a member of the LGBTQ+ community. This issue has become central to the deliberations of the synod taking place in Rome.

title: French minister Darmanin looks to strengthen judicial cooperation between France and the UAE
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin met with his Emirati counterpart in Dubai, on Wednesday, October 25. The Gulf country is regularly singled out as a haven for members of organized crime.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Macron calls for 'humanitarian truce'
summary: The president also said France wants to evacuate its citizens trapped in the Gaza Strip.

title: With two aircraft carriers, the US wants to create a naval bubble around Israel
summary: Following the dispatch of the USS Gerald R. Ford, the United States announced the arrival of the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower in the Mediterranean within the next few days. This force of over 15,000 sailors is primarily aimed at deterring regional escalation with Iran.

title: In Kinshasa, Mélenchon affirms his 'fraternity' with the DRC against Rwanda's 'abuses'
summary: On a visit to the Democratic Republic of Congo, the French left-wing politician lent his support to the authorities and denounced Kigali's 'expansionist aims.'

title: On Moscow visit, Hamas leaders rule out release of hostages without a ceasefire
summary: On Thursday, Russia's deputy foreign minister met with Hamas leaders. Since October 7, Moscow has clearly adopted an anti-Israel stance in the hope of weakening the West's support of Ukraine.

title: Crypto entrepreneur Bankman-Fried denies fraud in court
summary: While the FTX founder acknowledged some of his failures early in his testimony in federal court on Friday, he has denied that he defrauded anyone and pled not guilty.

title: 2024 US Election: Dean Phillips announces Democrat nomination bid
summary: Phillips, a Minnesota congressman, has argued that Biden may be unable to beat Trump again and has encouraged other primary challengers: 'I think it's time for a new generation.'

title: Russia tracks down migrants to fill its army's ranks
summary: To reinforce its troops in Ukraine, and avoid an unpopular new wave of military mobilization, the Kremlin has been arresting and deceiving foreign workers, going as far as raiding mosques for them.

title: French government unveils tough measures four months after riots
summary: But apart from some firm measures on juvenile justice and parental accountability, Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne's announcements were either not new or unspecific.

title: Retired Colombian army officer sentenced in US over 2021 assassination of Haiti's president
summary: He is the second of 11 suspects charged in Miami with conspiring and supporting a plot to kill the Haitian president. Both suspects have received life prison sentences.

title: UN General Assembly passes resolution for humanitarian truce in Gaza
summary: The 193-member world body adopted the non-binding resolution by a vote of 120-14 with 45 abstentions. France voted for the measure; Germany, Italy and Britain abstained; while Austria and the United States voted against it.
